chatter.text: Still alive? That's too bad, we had a bet goin'.

replies.text: Can you tell me about this region?

chatter.text: Friendly banter ain't worth the spit it costs in the Gap. Get though or get dead. Sooner you learn that, the later you'll croak.

replies.text: I was hoping you would introduce yourself.

chatter.text: And I was hoping to retire ten years ago. Name's Tyg. I run this hell hole. Any other burning questions?

replies.text: So this is your trade post?
What is keeping you from retiring?
I would like to talk about something else.
replies.next_text: Guess that's not illegal.

chatter.text: Used to run spice for the Harks. Got tired of them. Got tired of taking orders. Sandflies wanted me, but I can't stomach their mewling politics.

replies.next_text: Who, not what. Lazy bastards, the lot of them. Holed up in the Shield Wall. Want a wage without doin' the work. Give the rest of us duners a bad name.
Then you know they're good for nothing. Most of 'em leastways. Wonder if Troski's still kickin' it though, she owes me a tooth. Don't ask.

chatter.text: You think and old timer like me can't tap a keg? I do just fine.

replies.text: You just don't seem the entrepreneurial type.
replies.next_text: Don't give a spit about accumulating solaris. Just want my own place. To be left alone. Yet you desert fleas keep occasioning me to scratch.

replies.text: I want to know more about this place.
replies.next_text: Course you do. I call it the Anvil, 'cause of the Hammer. Only joke I ever made.If it's perishable, I don't stock it. That's all there is to tell.
Yet, you got more questions.

chatter.text: That's a might pretty way to say criminals. In here, they're meek as mice. I got the only spice beer in the Gap, so behooves them to behave.

replies.next_text: Huh. Sure. Some of them get to leave.

chatter.text: Was always nice and quiet 'round here, back when the Fremen were at Mirzabah. Nobody dared come near. Then the Sardaukar ruined everything.
The pogrom. They gutted the Fremen like animals. After that, the bandits all came crawling out of their holes. Now look at this place. It's packed.

replies.text: What does that have to do with retiring?

chatter.text: Can't well leave these cutthroats to starve can I? They're regulars. 'Sides, who'd be fool enough to take over this den of thieves from me?

replies.text: It almost sounds like you enjoy having people around.
replies.next_text: Spread slander like that and you best make peace with your tongue.

chatter.text: The Vermillius Gap? I ain't no Mentat, but this desert and I are on intimate terms.

replies.text: The red sand--why is it like that?
replies.next_text: That's 'cause the iron. Used to be the big industry here for it. You can still see some of the old rigs. Long, long ago, 'fore the spice craze.

replies.text: What dangers should I watch out for?

replies.next_text: You take me for a tour guide? See that big rock, shaped like a hammer? That's Mirzabah. Great view. Start there. See what you can figure out.

replies.text: I would like to talk about something else.
replies.next_text: Guess that's not illegal.

chatter.text: Used to be the Fremen owned this patch of sand. 'til the Emperor had 'em all killed. That's when the blasted Kirab slinked in.

replies.text: Do you think the Fremen really are dead?
replies.next_text: Most of 'em, sure. They'd rather die young, knife in hand. Older I get, the more sense I see in that. All of 'em though? They're a tenacious lot.

replies.text: Anyone else I should know about?
replies.next_text: There's them two staring daggers at each other younder. Spycraft recruiters for the Atreides and Harkonnen. Passive aggression makes my nethers itch.
I 'ppreciate the sycophancy.

chatter.text: Scavengers turned bandits. Got to figuring slitting throats was the more reliable work. They rove in small, nomadic bands.

replies.text: They sound like a menace. Why not get rid of them?

chatter.text: They're rat bastards, but they're paying customers. We have a deal. They operate in the area, but cause no trouble here. Don't want to talk about it.

replies.text: Why make deal with people you loath so much?
replies.next_text: Best quite that question, lest you like a sucking chest wound.

chatter.text: Can I fly you somewhere today?

replies.text: I want you to fly me somewhere.

replies.next_text: I like to fly. Fast. Storms, worms or static - nothing stops me from getting where I need to go. But you know what I don't like much? Talking.

chatter.text: Music to my ears. Where do you want to go?
The basin is a pretty big place... could you narrow it down a little?

replies.text: On second thought, I'm fine right here.
replies.next_text: Suit yourself.

chatter.text: Myr's place? Yeah I know it. Scavengers territory.

replies.next_text: Suit yourself.

chatter.text: Hm, most folks try stay clear of Slaver gangs.

replies.next_text: Suit yourself.

chatter.text: Ever seen a 'thopter get snatched by a worm? That's why we're gonna fly high on this route.

replies.next_text: Suit yourself.

chatter.text: Atreides and their war levies - I can get you there, but I want a little extra for the trip.

replies.next_text: Suit yourself.

chatter.text: The Harkonnens love their docking fees - so that's going to cost a little extra.

replies.next_text: Suit yourself.
